context: Your Day 1 bloodwork and scan came back normal.
explanation: FSH/LH levels are baseline. Uterus looks clear. Everything is a GO for stimulation to start.
next_steps: Tomorrow ({{stim_start_date}}) evening, give yourself the FIRST injection of {{medication}} as per the chart Dr gave you.
reassurance: The hardest part is that first needle. After that, you'll get the hang of it!
call_to_action: Confirm you have the medications at home.

context: Aapka baseline check hua. Sab normal hai!
explanation: Ab stimulation shuru kar sakte hain. Har din ek injection {{time_pm}} ko dena hai.
next_steps: Injection karna hai toh YouTube mein 'Self Injection' video dekh lo. Bahut asaan hota hai. Cold injection dene se dil strong padta hai! ðŸ’ª
reassurance: Har din jo injection dete ho, wo egg grow karta hai. Process ko trust karo.
call_to_action: Medicine fridge mein safe rakh di?

explanation: After 3 days of {{medication}}, your follicles are looking at 10-12mm (target range). Hormones are responding well. No OHSS signs.
next_steps: Continue same dose. Next scan on {{next_scan_date}}.
reassurance: You are on track! Keep the injection timing consistent.
call_to_action: Stick to the protocol.

explanation: Follicles 10-12mm likne mein hain. Response achcha hai. Any side effects? Thand, unexplained fatigue sometimes hote hain, wo normal hai.
next_steps: Same injection {{time_pm}} ko diye chalein.
reassurance: Procedure track par chal raha hai. Aap stress mat lo.
call_to_action: Call if severe headache or abdominal pain.

context: Your follicles are slower to respond.
explanation: We are increasing {{medication}} from {{old_dose}} to {{new_dose}} starting today. Sometimes bodies need extra stimulation, especially if we're working with a lower ovarian reserve.
next_steps: Use the new vial Dr prescribed. Injection timing stays the same.
reassurance: This is a normal adjustment. Not everyone responds at the same speed.
call_to_action: Confirm you received the new prescription.

explanation: Increase {{medication}} to {{new_dose}} vial from tomorrow.
next_steps: Check your prescription email.
reassurance: Normal adjustment.
call_to_action: Confirm receipt.

explanation: Follicles are growing very fast ({{follicle_count}} follicles >{{follicle_size}}mm). To prevent OHSS, we are REDUCING {{medication}} from {{old_dose}} to {{new_dose}}.
next_steps: Switch to lower dose vial starting today.
reassurance: This is actually a good sign! You have great egg potential. We are just being cautious.
call_to_action: Understand the change? Reply YES.

context: Bahut achha response hai! Par dose kam karna padega.
explanation: Follicles bahut tez grow ho rahe hain. OHSS risk se bachne ke liye {{medication}} reduce kar rahe hain.
next_steps: Naya vial use karo.
reassurance: Ye acha sign hai! Ovarian reserve achha hai.
call_to_action: Got it?

eventName: Stimulation Trigger Shot Day - HCG 10,000 IU
explanation: It's time for the 'Trigger Shot' - {{medication}} {{dose}} IU. This makes the eggs mature and ready for extraction in 36 hours.
next_steps: Tonight at {{trigger_time_pm}}, give yourself this injection. Set a PHONE ALARM so you don't miss it!
reassurance: This is the most important injection. DO NOT miss the timing. Being even 30 mins late can impact the outcome.
call_to_action: Confirm you have the vial and syringe.

eventName: Stimulation Trigger Shot Day - HCG 10,000 IU
greeting: Hi {{patient_name}} ðŸ”¥ AAJ TRIGGER DENA HAI!
explanation: Aaj raat {{trigger_time_pm}} ko {{medication}} {{dose}} IU lena hai. Ye sab se important injection hai.
next_steps: Alarm set karo. Timing ko 30 mins ka variation bhi nahi chahiye.
reassurance: Ye injection ke baad 36 hours ke baad egg retrieve karenge. Sab kuch perfect timing pe hota hai.
call_to_action: Confirm karke bata.

context: Tomorrow is the big day - Egg Retrieval!
explanation:
**Pre-Procedure Requirements:** 
âœ“ NPO (Nothing by mouth) after 12 midnight. 
âœ“ Remove all jewelry/metal. 
âœ“ Wear loose clothes. 
âœ“ Arrive {{arrival_time}}.
next_steps: You will be under light sedation for 10 mins. {{partner_name}} will be in recovery with you.
reassurance: This is a minor procedure, but we take it very seriously. The success of the whole cycle depends on the quality of eggs we retrieve.
call_to_action: Got all the documents? ID, consent form?

explanation:
**Zaruri Kaam:** 
Aj 12 raat ke baad kuch nahi khana. Subah thoda paani piyo lekin 2 ghante pehle band kar dena. Jwellery uttar dena.
next_steps: Sedation denge toh procedure painless hoga. Aadhe ghante mein ho jayega.
reassurance: Ye moment sabse exciting hota hai jab hum aapke liye perfect egg nikalte hain.
call_to_action: Doosra person (hubby) saath lana.

explanation: We successfully retrieved **{{egg_count}} mature eggs** of excellent quality! This is a great number for your age and ovarian reserve.
next_steps: Rest at home today. Light spotting is normal. Avoid strenuous activity for 48 hours. Continue {{medication}} as prescribed.
reassurance: Tomorrow we will fertilize the eggs. The next update will be 'Fertilization Report' on Day 1.
call_to_action: Drink water and eat light today.

explanation: {{egg_count}} perfect eggs nikaley! Sab thik hai.
next_steps: Aaj aram karo. Kal fertilization report milega.
reassurance: Process achche se chal raha hai!
call_to_action: Rest today.

eventName: Egg Pickup Procedure - Low Yield Sensitivity
explanation: We retrieved **{{egg_count}} eggs**. I know you were hoping for more, and I understand your disappointment. This happens sometimes, especially with lower ovarian reserves. But quality matters more than quantity.
next_steps: We will fertilize all {{egg_count}} immediately using ICSI if needed. Even one good embryo can lead to pregnancy.
reassurance: It takes only ONE perfect embryo. Let's focus on what we have. The fertilization report tomorrow will tell us how well they respond.
call_to_action: Rest today. Try not to stress.

eventName: Egg Pickup Procedure - Low Yield Sensitivity
context: [EMPATHY] I know the egg count was lower than expected.
explanation: Sometimes the ultrasound shows {{expected_follicles}} follicles, but only {{retrieved_follicles}} were mature/retrievable. This is totally normal and doesn't mean anything is wrong with your body.
next_steps: Tomorrow we'll see how many fertilize. We have patients who had 3 eggs, got 2 embryos, and had their baby.
reassurance: Trust the process. We are rooting for you.
call_to_action: If you're feeling sad or anxious, please talk to the counselor.

context: Here is how your eggs did overnight.
explanation:
Of {{egg_count}} eggs: 
âœ“ {{fertilized_count}} are FERTILIZED (normal, 2 pronuclei) 
â€¢ {{abnormal_count}} are abnormal (polyspermic/no fusion) 
â€¢ {{unfertilized_count}} did not fertilize (may be immature)
next_steps: The {{fertilized_count}} embryos are now in the incubator, dividing. Next report on Day 3.
reassurance: A {{fertilization_rate}}% fertilization rate is excellent! Your embryos are in good hands.
call_to_action: Rest and avoid activity.

explanation: {{fertilized_count}} egg successfully fertilize ho gaye! {{abnormal_count}} abnormal the. Ab hum embryos ko incubator mein rakhe hue hain.
next_steps: Day 3 par report milega.
reassurance: Fertilization achchi hai!
call_to_action: Relax karo.

context: Fertilization report - we need to talk.
explanation:
Of {{egg_count}} eggs, only {{fertilized_count}} fertilized. This is lower than expected. It could be due to:
â€¢ Egg quality (age-related)
â€¢ Sperm issues (even if analysis was normal)
â€¢ Timing issues with ICSI
next_steps: We are keeping the {{fertilized_count}} embryos in culture. We will continue monitoring closely.
reassurance: We still have {{fertilized_count}} embryos working for us. Miracles happen with even one embryo.
call_to_action: Dr. {{doctor_name}} wants to discuss options for future cycles. Call to book a time.

context: [EMPATHETIC] The fertilization results are not what we hoped.
explanation: Only {{fertilized_count}} out of {{egg_count}} fertilized. This is frustrating because we retrieved good eggs, but something in the sperm-egg interaction went wrong.
next_steps: For the next cycle, we can consider: (a) Doing an ICSI on ALL eggs (not just poor sperm), (b) Checking for DNA fragmentation in sperm, (c) Using donor sperm.
reassurance: One embryo is enough. Let's see how these {{fertilized_count}} develop.
call_to_action: I want to see you for a consultation to strategize.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, this is Dr. {{doctor_name}}. I have difficult news.
context: [VERY EMPATHETIC] Unfortunately, none of your eggs fertilized overnight.
explanation: This is rare but happens. The most common causes are: (1) All eggs were immature despite looking mature, (2) Sperm viability/motility issue, or (3) Unexpected fertilization dysfunction.
next_steps: This cycle is not viable. But this is NOT the end. Before the next cycle, we need to do: (a) Sperm DNA fragmentation test, (b) Check {{partner_name}}'s hormone levels, (c) PVP (Physiological Plasma) testing.
reassurance: Fertilization failure in cycle 1 does NOT mean it will happen again. Many patients with total fertilization failure go on to success with protocol adjustments.
call_to_action: I'm scheduling an emergency counseling + planning session for you both.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, we need to talk urgently. ðŸ’™
explanation: Unfortunately, none of the {{egg_count}} eggs fertilized. This is a rare outcome, but it means we cannot proceed with a transfer this cycle.
next_steps: Dr. {{doctor_name}} is calling you today to discuss what happened and plan for next time. We have options.
reassurance: This does NOT mean your situation is hopeless. We will investigate and adjust the protocol.
call_to_action: Please take the call from Dr. {{doctor_name}}.

eventName: Embryo Development Day 3 Report - Good Morphology
explanation:
Your embryos are dividing beautifully! 
âœ“ {{grade_a_count}} Grade A (perfect) 
âœ“ {{grade_b_count}} Grade B (good) 
â€¢ {{grade_c_count}} Grade C (fair, may not make it to Day 5)
next_steps: We are continuing to culture all embryos to Day 5 for final selection before transfer.
reassurance: Grade A and B embryos have the highest implantation rates. You are on track!
call_to_action: No action needed. We will update on Day 5.

eventName: Embryo Development Day 3 Report - Good Morphology
explanation: {{grade_a_count}} Grade A embryos! {{grade_b_count}} Grade B! Sab ko apna best develop kar rahe hain.
next_steps: Kal Day 5 par report milega. Tab best embryo select karenge transfer ke liye.
reassurance: Quality achchi lag rahi hai!
call_to_action: Keep calm!

eventName: Embryo Development Day 3 Report - Arrest or Degradation
context: Day 3 embryo morphology report came back.
explanation: We have {{viable_count}} embryos still developing well. However, {{arrested_count}} have stopped dividing or are degrading. This is unfortunately not uncommon and doesn't mean something is 'wrong' - sometimes embryos are just not viable.
next_steps: We will continue monitoring the {{viable_count}} good ones to Day 5 blastocyst stage.
reassurance: It only takes ONE good blastocyst to get pregnant. Let's see how the remaining embryos do.
call_to_action: No action from you. We will update Day 5.

eventName: Embryo Development Day 3 Report - Arrest or Degradation
context: Day 3 update mein kuch embryos ne development band kar di.
explanation: {{viable_count}} achche embryos ab bhi develop ho rahe hain. {{arrested_count}} stop ho gaye. Ye normal hota hai kabhi kabhi.
next_steps: Day 5 par dekhenge final status.
reassurance: Best embryo select karenge.
call_to_action: Have faith.

explanation: Excellent news! You have {{blast_count}} Grade A/B blastocysts with perfect ICM and TE grades. We are selecting the **BEST ONE** for fresh transfer today.
next_steps: **Embryo Transfer scheduled for {{transfer_time}}**. Come 30 mins early. Your uterus is thick and receptive.
reassurance: Blastocyst-stage transfer has the highest implantation rates (40-50%). You are in great shape!
call_to_action: Confirm your arrival time.

explanation: Perfect quality ke {{blast_count}} blastocysts ban gaye! Grade A/B. Ab transfer karenge aaj.
next_steps: {{transfer_time}} par clinic aao.
reassurance: Ye moment sabse khushi wala hota hai!
call_to_action: Confirm time.

explanation: You have {{blast_count}} blastocyst(s) that reached Stage 5-6 with good morphology (Grade B/C). {{still_dividing}} are still dividing and may catch up by tomorrow.
next_steps: We recommend waiting until tomorrow (Day 6) to see if any more blastocysts form, then decide on fresh transfer vs. freeze.
reassurance: Sometimes blastocysts develop a day late. Patience pays off.
call_to_action: Call us to decide: fresh transfer today or wait for Day 6?

context: [COMPASSIONATE] Unfortunately, none of your embryos reached blastocyst stage by Day 5.
explanation: The {{day_3_count}} Day 3 embryos continued dividing but stopped before forming a full blastocyst. This is a rare outcome and could indicate: (a) Sperm quality issues, (b) Egg quality (age), or (c) Embryo development dysfunction.
next_steps: We will continue culturing to Day 6 to see if any last-minute blasts form. If not, this cycle will be cancelled.
reassurance: This does NOT mean you cannot get pregnant. We will do a full investigation before the next cycle.
call_to_action: Dr. {{doctor_name}} will call you to discuss next steps.

context: You have {{extra_blast_count}} extra blastocysts beyond the one we're transferring.
explanation: These are Grade A/B and excellent candidates for freezing. Frozen embryos give you future chances without another retrieval cycle (save â‚¹1L+ and hormones).
next_steps: Freezing process takes 2 hours using Vitrification (fast-freeze). Survival rate is 85-95% after thaw.
reassurance: Having 'backup' embryos is insurance. Many patients use frozen transfers for their second/third child.
call_to_action: Confirm you want to freeze. Cost is â‚¹15k per embryo for first year.

context: Extra embryos freeze karne ke baare mein.
explanation: {{extra_blast_count}} extra perfect embryos hain. Freeze kar sakte hain jo future mein use kar sakte hain. Cost sirf â‚¹15k ek saal ke liye.
next_steps: Freeze kara lo. Ye future cycle ke liye insurance hai.
reassurance: Bohot faydey wali cheez. Bachche ke baad doosri baby plan karni pad sakti hai!
call_to_action: Freeze kara lo?

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, TODAY IS THE DAY! ðŸ’«
explanation:
**Pre-Transfer Checklist:** 
âœ“ Have a full bladder (helps ultrasound visualization) 
âœ“ Wear comfortable clothes 
âœ“ Bring partner/support person 
âœ“ Light snacks allowed 
âœ“ NO intercourse for 3 days post-transfer
next_steps: The transfer takes 5 mins. You will see the embryo go in on the ultrasound screen. Very magical moment!
reassurance: Your {{blast_grade}} graded embryo is strong. You've got this!
call_to_action: See you in {{hours_remaining}} hours!

explanation: Procedure sirf 5 min lega. Anesthesia nahi, bas ultrasound dekh sakte ho.
next_steps: Ek ghante baad ghar ja sakte ho. Rest karo.
reassurance: Ye moment sabse special hota hai!
call_to_action: On our way?

context: Embryo is now in your uterus!
explanation:
**Post-Transfer Care:** 
âœ“ Rest today. Bed rest is NOT scientifically proven to help, but relaxation is good. 
âœ“ Continue {{medications}} (estrogen/progesterone). 
âœ“ Avoid heavy lifting, strenuous exercise, or intercourse for 3-5 days. 
âœ“ Light walking is okay.
next_steps: Beta-hCG blood test on {{beta_date}} ({{days_post_transfer}} days post-transfer).
reassurance: The embryo is safely inside. Try not to obsess over 'did it work?' for the next 10 days.
call_to_action: Rest well. We believe in you.

explanation: Ab take medicine {{time_am}} aur {{time_pm}} ko lo. Koi bhi activity rukwana mushkil nahi hai par bas rest karo aaj.
next_steps: Beta blood test {{beta_date}} ko.
reassurance: Embryo ab aapka part hai. Positive sochte raho!
call_to_action: Rest.

explanation: Progesterone {{time_pm}}. Do not skip!
next_steps: Consistency is key.
reassurance: Supporting implantation.
call_to_action: Take dose.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, Tomorrow is BETA DAY! ðŸ§ª
context: {{days_post_transfer}} days post-transfer. Time for the truth!
explanation: Come for blood draw at {{lab_time}}. Fast overnight if possible (not mandatory, but helps). The lab will measure hCG (pregnancy hormone). hCG >5 is positive. >10 is strong.
next_steps: Results usually available by evening. We will call you.
reassurance: Whatever the result, we are proud of your courage.
call_to_action: See you tomorrow morning!

explanation: Subah early aao. Blood test. Shaam tak report mil jayega.
next_steps: {{lab_time}} pe.
reassurance: Finally answer milega!
call_to_action: See you tomorrow!

explanation: **hCG Level: {{hcg_value}} mIU/ml** (Normal is >5). You are PREGNANT! ðŸ¤°ðŸ’š
next_steps: Continue all medications without interruption. Repeat beta on {{second_beta_date}} to confirm doubling (should go >{{expected_hcg}}).
reassurance: This is just the beginning! We will monitor closely with scans to ensure a healthy pregnancy.
call_to_action: Take a moment to celebrate. You did it!

explanation: {{hcg_value}} mIU/ml! PREGNANT! ðŸ¤°
next_steps: Medicines continue. Kal repeat beta.
reassurance: Finally! Aapka khwab sach ho gaya!
call_to_action: Celebrate!

explanation: **hCG Level: <5 mIU/ml** (Below threshold for pregnancy). This cycle did not result in pregnancy. ðŸ˜”
next_steps: Stop all progesterone. You will get your period in 3-5 days. Come for a 'Cycle Review' after that.
reassurance: This is NOT the end. Many patients succeed on their second or third attempt. The good news: your eggs fertilize, your uterus receives well. We will troubleshoot and try again.
call_to_action: Please talk to the counselor today. You need support.

explanation: Your hCG came back negative. The embryo did not implant this time.
next_steps: The cycle is over. Stop progesterone. When your period comes, book a counseling + planning session with me to understand what happened and what we change next time.
reassurance: A negative beta does NOT mean the next one will be negative. Many couples conceive on attempt 2 or 3.
call_to_action: Take care of yourself. Be kind to {{partner_name}}.

explanation: {{hcg_value}} <5. Ye baar pregnancy nahi hua.
next_steps: Progesterone band kar dena. Period aayega 3-4 din mein.
reassurance: Ye end nahi hai. Bohot se couples doosri baar successful hote hain!
call_to_action: Counselor ko call karo.

explanation:
**Gestational Sac:** {{gsa_size}}mm (Normal for 6 weeks) 
**Fetal Pole:** Visible with strong heartbeat at {{hr}} bpm (100-160 is healthy) 
**Viability:** Excellent! ðŸŽ‰
next_steps: Continue medications until 12 weeks (to ensure stable placenta). Next scan at 8-9 weeks.
reassurance: Seeing the heartbeat means the pregnancy is REAL and viable. This is the moment many couples finally relax.
call_to_action: You can now tell family if you want!

explanation: Heartbeat {{hr}} bpm! Perfect! Sab normal hai!
next_steps: Medicines continue. Next scan 2 weeks mein.
reassurance: Ab aap pregnancy enjoy kar sakte ho! Risk kam ho gaya.
call_to_action: Congratulations!

context: [VERY GENTLE] I have difficult news from the 6-week scan.
explanation: The scan shows a gestational sac but no fetal pole or heartbeat is visible. This suggests a **Blighted Ovum** or **Early Miscarriage**. I am deeply sorry.
next_steps: Options: (1) Wait for natural miscarriage (may take 1-2 weeks), (2) Medical management with medication, or (3) D&C procedure. We will support you through whichever you choose.
reassurance: This is NOT your fault. Early miscarriages happen in 15-20% of pregnancies and usually indicate a chromosomal issue that couldn't be viable.
call_to_action: Come in tomorrow so we can discuss options and give you proper support.

explanation: After {{stim_day}} days of stimulation, your follicles are not responding as expected ({{follicle_size}}mm, {{follicle_count}} follicles). The hormone levels are also low. At this rate, retrieval would not be successful.
next_steps: We recommend **CANCELLING THIS CYCLE** to prevent waste of time/money. We will analyze what went wrong and adjust protocol for next cycle (higher doses, different medications, or even a 'mini' protocol).
reassurance: Cancelled cycles are NOT failures. They are course corrections. Many patients succeed in attempt 2.
call_to_action: Come in for a planning meeting with Dr. {{doctor_name}}.

explanation: {{stim_day}} din ke baad follicles achche se grow nahi ho rahe. {{follicle_count}} hi follicles hain jo {{follicle_size}}mm ke. Cost behtar hai ki cycle cancel kar dein.
next_steps: Ek consultation lenge toh doosri baar strong protocol chalenge.
reassurance: Ye mushkil nahi, sirf adjustment hai.
call_to_action: Book consultation.

context: Day {{stim_day}} scan shows ovarian hyperstimulation risk.
explanation: You have {{follicle_count}} large follicles and very high estrogen ({{estrogen_value}}). Risk of **OHSS** (Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome) is high. Proceeding with retrieval would be dangerous to your health.
next_steps: We are **CANCELLING THIS CYCLE**. Come for bloodwork today to confirm hormone levels. We will monitor until ovaries return to normal.
reassurance: Your health is more important than one cycle. We can do a 'Freeze All' strategy next time (retrieve, freeze ALL embryos, transfer next month when your body recovers).
call_to_action: Come in today for safety bloodwork.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, Dr. {{doctor_name}} here with important news.
context: [SERIOUS BUT SUPPORTIVE] For your safety, we must cancel this cycle.
explanation: Your ovaries are showing signs of severe hyperstimulation. Proceeding with egg pickup could trigger OHSS, which can be seriously uncomfortable or even require hospitalization.
next_steps: We stop all medications immediately. You will go on birth control or mini-pill for 1-2 weeks to let ovaries settle. Then we plan the next cycle with a lower dose protocol.
reassurance: This is NOT a failure. It shows you respond WELL to medications. We just over-stimulated. Next cycle will be better controlled.
call_to_action: Trust us on this. Your long-term fertility is what matters.

context: Regarding your request to cancel the cycle.
explanation: We understand and respect your decision to pause treatment. Whether it's due to cost, stress, health concerns, or just needing a breakâ€”this is YOUR body and YOUR journey.
next_steps: We will preserve any frozen embryos you have (no cost for storage for 12 months). When you're ready to resume, just reach out.
reassurance: Taking a break does not reduce your future chances. Many patients find a pause mentally resets them.
call_to_action: Let's schedule an exit counseling so we can support your next steps.

eventName: Frozen Embryo Thaw and Transfer Planning
context: You have {{frozen_embryo_count}} frozen embryos from your previous cycle.
explanation: We are planning a **Frozen Embryo Transfer (FET)**. This is simpler: no ovulation induction, just a natural or hormone-prepared cycle to prepare the uterus.
next_steps: Expect your next period on {{expected_period}}. We will scan on Day 9-10 of next cycle to check uterine thickness.
reassurance: FET has similar success rates to fresh transfer (40-50%) but is less invasive and â‚¹50k cheaper.
call_to_action: Confirm you want to proceed with FET.

eventName: Frozen Embryo Thaw and Transfer Planning
explanation: {{frozen_embryo_count}} embryo thaw karenge next cycle mein.
next_steps: Period aane ke baad hum aapko scan karaenge.
reassurance: FET easy hota hai!
call_to_action: Ready?

context: [EMERGENCY TONE] Based on your symptoms and blood work, you have **Severe OHSS** and need immediate hospitalization.
explanation: Severe OHSS (extreme abdominal bloating, vomiting, weight gain >2kg/day, shortness of breath) can cause internal bleeding or organ dysfunction. You need IV fluids, monitoring, and possibly a paracentesis (fluid drainage).
next_steps: We are admitting you to {{hospital_name}}. The gynecologist will coordinate with ICU. You will be discharged when stable (usually 3-5 days).
reassurance: OHSS is temporary and treatable. Your ovaries will return to normal.
call_to_action: Pack a bag. Bring ID and insurance card. {{partner_name}} should come.

explanation: Hospitalization zaruri hai. Severe OHSS ke signs ho rahe hain.
next_steps: Hospital admission. Dr paas phone par bolegi.
reassurance: Thik ho jayega. Temporary hai.
call_to_action: Ready ho jao.

context: You have Mild-Moderate OHSS. You can manage at home with close monitoring.
explanation: **Symptoms:** Abdominal bloating, mild nausea, minimal weight gain. **Safe to manage at home if:** Kidney function normal, no shortness of breath, abdominal not severely tender.
next_steps: 1. Drink 2-3L electrolyte solution (ORS/Pedialyte) daily. 2. Wear compression stockings. 3. Sleep with elevated legs. 4. Weigh daily. 4. Come for bloodwork every 2 days.
reassurance: OHSS peaks at 5-7 days post-retrieval, then improves. You will be fine.
call_to_action: Call if symptoms worsen (vomiting, weight gain >1kg/day, chest pain, fainting).

explanation: Mild bloating normal hai. Ghar par manage kar sakte ho. ORS piyo. Legs up rakh ke sona.
next_steps: Daily weight check karo. Zyada heavy ho toh call karna.
reassurance: 1 week mein thik ho jayega!
call_to_action: Symptoms bad ho toh call.

context: [EMPATHETIC] I need to explain something that happened during retrieval.
explanation: During egg pickup, some follicles were aspirated but contained **no egg inside**. This is called **'Empty Follicle Syndrome'**. It happens when the egg didn't mature properly or the follicle wall was too thick.
next_steps: This doesn't affect the embryos we DID retrieve. But for future cycles, we can try: (a) Earlier trigger time, (b) Different trigger medication (Leuprolide vs HCG), (c) Higher doses.
reassurance: Empty follicles in 10-15% of retrieved follicles is normal. You still got good eggs overall.
call_to_action: Let's discuss protocol changes for next cycle.

context: During egg pickup, we aspirated {{empty_count}} empty follicles.
explanation: Despite follicles looking mature on ultrasound, some had no egg inside. This happens in 10-15% of cases and doesn't mean anything is 'wrong'.
next_steps: We retrieved {{good_egg_count}} good eggs which is still a solid number. For next cycle, we can optimize trigger timing.
reassurance: Empty follicles don't affect the eggs you DO have.
call_to_action: Focus on the embryos we created.

context: [VERY SUPPORTIVE] I know the TFF (Total Fertilization Failure) diagnosis is devastating.
explanation: None of your {{egg_count}} eggs fertilized despite looking mature. This is NOT your fault and is NOT the end of your fertility journey. TFF happens in 1-3% of IVF cycles and doesn't predict future success.
next_steps: Before next cycle, we recommend: (1) Sperm DNA Fragmentation test for {{partner_name}}, (2) Consider ICSI for all eggs next time (not just abnormal sperm), (3) Check your AMH/FSH.
reassurance: Couples with TFF have gone on to successful pregnancies in subsequent cycles after investigating and adjusting protocols.
call_to_action: Schedule a TFF counseling + planning meeting with me.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, we are here for you ðŸ’™
explanation: Fertilization failure is a rare outcome but NOT the end. We will investigate fully before attempt 2.
next_steps: Sperm testing, protocol review, and plan B ready for next cycle.
reassurance: Many TFF patients succeed next time.
call_to_action: Let's meet to plan the next cycle together.

explanation: Some of your embryos stopped dividing after Day 3. This can be due to: (a) Sperm DNA damage (even if semen analysis looked normal), (b) Egg quality (age-related), or (c) Random chromosomal abnormality.
next_steps: For next cycle, consider: PGT-A testing (to detect chromosomally normal embryos), ICSI, or Donor Sperm if DNA is the issue.
reassurance: It's not the end. You still have {{viable_count}} embryos developing.
call_to_action: Let's discuss next steps.

context: Day 3 ke baad embryo divide band ho gaye.
explanation: Kabhi kabhi chromosomal issues ya sperm quality se embryos stop hote hain.
next_steps: Next cycle mein PGT-A testing kar sakte hain.
reassurance: {{viable_count}} achche embryos ab bhi hain!
call_to_action: Next plan discuss karenge.
